summary.long: Revelation is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: This is the revelation of Jesus the Messiah, which God gave him to show his servants the things that must happen soon. He made it known by sending his messenger to his servant John,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who testified about this message from God and the testimony about Jesus the Messiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How blessed is the one who reads aloud and those who hear the words of this prophecy and obey what is written in it, for the time is near!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From John to the seven churches in Asia. May grace and peace be yours from the one who is, who was, and who is coming, from the seven spirits who are in front of his throne,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and from Jesus the Messiah, the witness, the faithful one, the firstborn from the dead, and the ruler over the kings of the earth. To the one who loves us and has freed us from our sins by his blood
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and has made us a kingdom, priests for his God and Father, be glory and power forever and ever! Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look! He is coming in the clouds.
    Every eye will see him,
        even those who pierced him,
and all the tribes of the earth will mourn
    because of him.
So be it! Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I am the Alpha and the Omega,” declares the Lord God, “the one who is, who was, and who is coming, the Almighty.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am John, your brother and partner in the oppression, kingdom, and patience that comes because of Jesus. I was on the island called Patmos because of the word of God and the testimony about Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I came to be in the Spirit on the Day of the Lord, when I heard a loud voice behind me like a trumpet,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: saying, “Write on a scroll what you see, and send it to the seven churches: Ephesus, Smyrna, Pergamum, Thyatira, Sardis, Philadelphia, and Laodicea.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I turned to see who was talking to me, and when I turned I saw seven gold lamp stands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Among the lamp stands there was someone like the Son of Man. He was wearing a long robe with a gold sash around his chest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His head and his hair were white like wool, in fact, as white as snow. His eyes were like flames of fire,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: his feet were like glowing bronze refined in a furnace, and his voice was like the sound of raging waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In his right hand he held seven stars, and out of his mouth came a sharp, two-edged sword. His face was like the sun when it shines with full force.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I saw him, I fell down at his feet like a dead man. But he placed his right hand on me and said, “Stop being afraid! I am the first and the last,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the living one. I was dead—but look!—I am alive forever and ever! I have the keys of Death and Hades.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, write down what you have seen, what is, and what is going to happen after this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The secret meaning of the seven stars that you saw in my right hand and the seven gold lamp stands is this: the seven stars are the messengers of the seven churches, and the seven lamp stands are the seven churches.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“To the messenger of the church in Ephesus, write:
‘The one who holds the seven stars in his right hand, the one who walks among the seven gold lamp stands, says this:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘I know what you’ve been doing, your toil, and your endurance. I also know that you cannot tolerate evil people. You have tested those who call themselves apostles, but are not, and have found them to be false.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have endured and suffered because of my name, yet you have not grown weary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, I have this against you: You have abandoned the love you had at first.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, remember how far you have fallen. Repent and go back to what you were doing at first. If you don’t, I will come to you and remove your lamp stand from its place—unless you repent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But this is to your credit: You hate the actions of the Nicolaitans, which I also hate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Let everyone listen to what the Spirit says to the churches. I will give the privilege of eating from the tree of life that is in God’s paradise to everyone who overcomes.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“To the messenger of the church in Smyrna, write:
‘The first and the last, who was dead and became alive, says this:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘I know your suffering and your poverty—though you are rich—and the slander committed by those who claim to be Jews but are not. They are the synagogue of Satan.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t be afraid of what you are going to suffer. Look! The Devil is going to throw some of you into prison so that you may be tested. For ten days you will undergo suffering. Be faithful until death, and I will give you the victor’s crown of life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Let everyone listen to what the Spirit says to the churches. The one who overcomes will never be hurt by the second death.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“To the messenger of the church in Pergamum, write:
‘The one who holds the sharp, two-edged sword, says this:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘I know where you live. Satan’s throne is there. Yet you hold on to my name and have not denied your faith in me, even in the days of Antipas, my faithful witness, who was killed in your presence, where Satan lives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I have a few things against you: You have there some who hold to the teaching of Balaam, the one who taught Balak to put a stumbling block before the people of Israel so that they would eat food sacrificed to idols and practice immorality.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You also have some who hold to the teaching of the Nicolaitans.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So repent. If you don’t, I will come to you quickly and wage war against them with the sword of my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Let everyone listen to what the Spirit says to the churches. I will give some of the hidden manna to everyone who overcomes.’” I will also give him a white stone. On the white stone is written a new name that no one knows except the person who receives it.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“To the messenger of the church in Thyatira, write:
‘The Son of God, whose eyes are like flaming fire and whose feet are like glowing bronze, says this:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘I know what you’ve been doing—your love, faithfulness, service, and endurance—and that your last actions are greater than the first.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I have this against you: You tolerate that woman Jezebel, who calls herself a prophet and who teaches and leads my servants to practice immorality and to eat food sacrificed to idols.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I gave her time to repent, but she refused to repent of her immorality.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look! I am going to strike her with illness. Those who commit adultery with her will also suffer greatly, unless they repent from acting like her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will strike her children dead. Then all the churches will know that I am the one who searches minds and hearts. I will reward each of you as your actions deserve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘But as for the rest of you in Thyatira—you who do not hold to this teaching and who have not learned what some people call the deep things of Satan—I won’t burden you with anything else.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just hold on to what you have until I come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will give authority over the nations to the person who overcomes and continues to do what I’ve commanded to the end, and
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘He will rule them with an iron scepter;
    shattering them like clay pots.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Just as I have received authority from my Father, I will also give him the morning star.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Let everyone listen to what the Spirit says to the churches.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“To the messenger of the church in Sardis, write:
‘The one who has the seven spirits of God and the seven stars says this:
‘I know what you’ve been doing. You are known for being alive, but you are dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Be alert, and strengthen the things that are left, which are about to die. I note that your actions are incomplete before my God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So remember what you received and heard. Obey it, and repent. If you are not alert, I will come like a thief, and you won’t know the time when I will come to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you have a few people in Sardis who have not soiled their clothes. They will walk with me in white clothes because they are worthy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The person who overcomes in this way will wear white clothes, and I will never erase his name from the Book of Life. I will acknowledge his name in the presence of my Father and his angels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Let everyone listen to what the Spirit says to the churches.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“To the messenger of the church in Philadelphia, write:
‘The one who is holy, who is true,
    who has the key of David,
who opens a door that no one can shut,
    and who shuts a door that no one can open,
‘says this:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘I know what you’ve been doing. Look! I have put in front of you an open door that no one can shut. You have only a little strength, but you have obeyed my word and have not denied my name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make those who belong to the synagogue of Satan—those who claim to be Jews and aren’t, but are lying—come and bow down at your feet. Then they will realize that I have loved you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because you have obeyed my command to endure, I will keep you from the hour of testing that is coming to the whole world to test those living on the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am coming soon! Hold on to what you have so that no one takes your victor’s crown.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make the one who overcomes to become a pillar in the sanctuary of my God, and he will never go out of it again. I will write on him the name of my God, the name of the city of my God (the new Jerusalem coming down out of heaven from God), and my own new name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Let everyone listen to what the Spirit says to the churches.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“To the messenger of the church in Laodicea, write:
‘The Amen, the witness who is faithful and true, the originator of God’s creation, says this:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘I know your actions, that you are neither cold nor hot. I wish you were cold or hot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since you are lukewarm and neither hot nor cold, I am going to spit you out of my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You say, “I am rich. I have become wealthy. I don’t need anything.” Yet you don’t realize that you are miserable, pitiful, poor, blind, and naked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, I advise you to buy from me gold purified in fire so you may be rich, white clothes to wear so your shameful nakedness won’t show, and ointment to put on your eyes so you may see.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I correct and discipline those whom I love, so be serious and repent!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look! I am standing at the door and knocking. If anyone listens to my voice and opens the door, I will come in to him and eat with him, and he will eat with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will give a place to sit with me on my throne to the one who overcomes, just as I have overcome and have sat down with my Father on his throne.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Let everyone listen to what the Spirit says to the churches.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After these things, I saw a door standing open in heaven. The first voice that I had heard speaking to me like a trumpet said, “Come up here, and I will show you what must happen after this.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Instantly I was in the Spirit, and I saw a throne in heaven with a person seated on the throne.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The person sitting there looked like jasper and carnelian, and there was a rainbow around the throne that looked like an emerald.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Around the throne were 24 other thrones, and on these thrones sat 24 elders wearing white robes and gold victor’s crowns on their heads.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Flashes of lightning, noises, and peals of thunder came from the throne. Burning in front of the throne were seven flaming torches, which are the seven spirits of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In front of the throne was something like a sea of glass as clear as crystal. In the center of the throne and on each side of the throne were four living creatures full of eyes in front and in back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The first living creature was like a lion, the second living creature was like an ox, the third living creature had a face like a human, and the fourth living creature was like a flying eagle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Each of the four living creatures had six wings and were full of eyes inside and out. Without stopping day or night they were saying,
“Holy, holy, holy
    is the Lord God Almighty,
        who was, who is, and who is coming.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Whenever the living creatures give glory, honor, and thanks to the one who sits on the throne, who lives forever and ever,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the 24 elders bow down and worship in front of the one who sits on the throne, the one who lives forever and ever. They throw their victor’s crowns in front of the throne and say,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“You are worthy, our Lord and God,
    to receive glory, honor, and power,
        because you created all things;
they came into existence
and were created because of your will.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I saw in the right hand of the one who sits on the throne a scroll written on the inside and on the outside, sealed with seven seals.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I also saw a powerful angel proclaiming with a loud voice, “Who is worthy to open the scroll and break its seals?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one in heaven, on earth, or under the earth could open the scroll or look inside it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I began to cry bitterly because no one was found worthy to open the scroll or look inside it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Stop crying,” one of the elders told me. “Look! The Lion from the tribe of Judah, the Root of David, has conquered. He can open the scroll and its seven seals.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I saw a lamb standing in the middle of the throne, the four living creatures, and the elders. He looked like he had been slaughtered. He had seven horns and seven eyes, which are the seven spirits of God sent into all the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went and took the scroll from the right hand of the one who sits on the throne.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the lamb had taken the scroll, the four living creatures and the twenty-four elders bowed down in front of him. Each held a harp and a gold bowl full of incense, the prayers of the saints.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They sang a new song:
“You are worthy to take the scroll and open its seals,
    because you were slaughtered.
With your blood you purchased us for God
    from every tribe, language, people, and nation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You made us a kingdom and priests for our God,
    and they will reign on the earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I looked, and I heard the voices of many angels, the living creatures, and the elders surrounding the throne. They numbered 10,000’s times 10,000 and thousands times thousands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They sang with a loud voice,
“Worthy is the lamb who was slaughtered
    to receive power, wealth, wisdom, strength, honor, glory, and praise!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I heard every creature in heaven, on earth, under the earth, and on the sea, and everything that is in them, saying,
“To the one who sits on the throne and to the lamb
    be praise, honor, glory, and power forever and ever!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the four living creatures said, “Amen!”, and the elders bowed down and worshipped.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I saw the lamb open the first of the seven seals. I heard one of the four living creatures say with a voice like thunder, “Go!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I looked, and there was a white horse! Its rider had a bow, and a victor’s crown had been given to him. He went out as a conqueror to conquer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the lamb opened the second seal, I heard the second living creature say, “Go!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A second horse went out. It was fiery red, and its rider was given permission to take peace away from the earth and to make people slaughter one another. So he was given a large sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the lamb opened the third seal, I heard the third living creature say, “Go!” I looked, and there was a black horse! Its rider held a scale in his hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I heard what sounded like a voice from among the four living creatures, saying, “One day’s ration of wheat for a day’s wage, or three day’s ration of barley for a day’s wage! But don’t damage the olive oil or the wine!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the lamb opened the fourth seal, I heard the voice of the fourth living creature say, “Go!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I looked, and there was a pale green horse! Its rider’s name was Death, and Hades followed him. They were given authority over one-fourth of the earth to kill people using wars, famines, plagues, and the wild animals of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the lamb opened the fifth seal, I saw under the altar the souls of those who had been slaughtered because of the word of God and the testimony they had given.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They cried out in a loud voice,
“Holy and true Sovereign,
    how long will it be before you judge
and take revenge on those living on the earth
    who shed our blood?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each of them was given a white robe. They were told to rest a little longer until the number of their fellow servants and their brothers was completed, who would be killed as they themselves had been.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I saw the lamb open the sixth seal. There was a powerful earthquake. The sun turned as black as sackcloth made of hair, and the full moon turned as red as blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The stars in the sky fell to the earth like a fig tree drops its fruit when it is shaken by a strong wind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sky vanished like a scroll being rolled up, and every mountain and island was moved from its place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the kings of the earth, the important people, the generals, the rich, the powerful, and all the slaves and free people concealed themselves in caves and among the rocks in the mountains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They told the mountains and rocks, “Fall on us and hide us from the face of the one who sits on the throne and from the wrath of the lamb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the great day of their wrath has come, and who is able to endure it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this, I saw four angels standing at the four corners of the earth. They were holding back the four winds of the earth so that no wind could blow on the land, on the sea, or on any tree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I saw another angel coming from the east having the seal of the living God. He cried out in a loud voice to the four angels who had been permitted to harm the land and sea,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Don’t harm the land, the sea, or the trees until we have marked the servants of our God with a seal on their foreheads.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I heard the number of those who were sealed: 144,000. Those who were sealed were from every tribe of Israel:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: 12,000 from the tribe of Judah were sealed, 12,000 from the tribe of Reuben, 12,000 from the tribe of Gad,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: 12,000 from the tribe of Asher, 12,000 from the tribe of Naphtali, 12,000 from the tribe of Manasseh,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: 12,000 from the tribe of Simeon, 12,000 from the tribe of Levi, 12,000 from the tribe of Issachar,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: 12,000 from the tribe of Zebulun, 12,000 from the tribe of Joseph, and 12,000 from the tribe of Benjamin were sealed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After these things, I looked, and there was a crowd so large that no one was able to count it! They were from every nation, tribe, people, and language. They were standing in front of the throne and the lamb and were wearing white robes, with palm branches in their hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They cried out in a loud voice,
“Salvation belongs to our God,
    who sits on the throne,
        and to the lamb!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the angels stood around the throne and around the elders and the four living creatures. They fell on their faces in front of the throne and worshipped God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
saying,
“Amen! Praise, glory, wisdom, thanks, honor, power, and strength
    be to our God forever and ever! Amen!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Who are these people wearing white robes,” one of the elders asked me, “and where did they come from?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I told him, “Sir, you know.”
Then he told me, “These are the people who are coming out of the terrible suffering. They have washed their robes and made them white in the blood of the lamb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That is why:
“They are in front of the throne of God
    and worship him night and day in his Temple.
The one who sits on the throne will shelter them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They will never be hungry or thirsty again.
    Neither the sun nor its heat will ever beat down on them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because the lamb in the center of the throne will be their shepherd.
    He will lead them to springs filled with the water of life,
        and God will wipe every tear from their eyes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the lamb opened the seventh seal, there was silence in heaven for about half an hour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I saw the seven angels who stand in God’s presence, and seven trumpets were given to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Another angel came with a gold censer and stood at the altar. He was given a large quantity of incense to offer on the gold altar before the throne, along with the prayers of all the saints.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The smoke from the incense and the prayers of the saints went up from the angel’s hand to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel took the censer, filled it with fire from the altar, and threw it on the earth. Then there were peals of thunder, noises, flashes of lightning, and an earthquake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seven angels who had the seven trumpets got ready to blow them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the first angel blew his trumpet, hail and fire were mixed with blood and thrown on the earth. One-third of the earth was burned up, one-third of the trees was burned up, and all the green grass was burned up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the second angel blew his trumpet, something like a huge mountain burning with fire was thrown into the sea. One-third of the sea turned into blood,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: one-third of the creatures that were living in the sea died, and one-third of the ships was destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the third angel blew his trumpet, a huge star blazing like a torch fell from heaven. It fell on one-third of the rivers and on the springs of water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The name of the star is Wormwood. One-third of the water turned into wormwood, and many people died from the water because it had turned bitter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the fourth angel blew his trumpet, one-third of the sun, one-third of the moon, and one-third of the stars were struck so that one-third of them turned dark. One-third of the day was kept from having light, as was the night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then I looked, and I heard an eagle flying overhead say in a loud voice,
“How terrible, how terrible, how terrible
    for those living on the earth,
because of the blasts of the remaining trumpets
    that the three angels are about to blow!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the fifth angel blew his trumpet, I saw a star that had fallen to earth from the sky. The star was given the key to the shaft of the bottomless pit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It opened the shaft of the bottomless pit, and smoke came out of the shaft like the smoke from a large furnace. The sun and the air were darkened with the smoke from the shaft.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Locusts came out of the smoke onto the earth, and they were given power like that of earthly scorpions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were told not to harm the grass on the earth, any green plant, or any tree. They could harm only the people who do not have the seal of God on their foreheads.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were not allowed to kill them, but were only allowed to torture them for five months. Their torture was like the pain of a scorpion when it stings someone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In those days people will seek death, but never find it. They will long to die, but death will escape them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The locusts looked like horses prepared for battle. On their heads were victor’s crowns that looked like gold, and their faces were like human faces.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They had hair like women’s hair and teeth like lions’ teeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They had breastplates like iron, and the noise of their wings was like the roar of chariots with many horses rushing into battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They had tails and stingers like scorpions, and they had the power to hurt people with their tails for five months.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They had the angel of the bottomless pit ruling over them as king. In Hebrew he is called Abaddon, and in Greek he is called Apollyon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The first catastrophe is over. After these things, there are still two more catastrophes to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the sixth angel blew his trumpet, I heard a voice from the four horns of the gold altar in front of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It told the sixth angel who had the trumpet, “Release the four angels who are held at the great Euphrates River.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the four angels who were ready for that hour, day, month, and year were released to kill one-third of humanity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The number of cavalry troops was 200,000,000. I heard how many there were.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was how I saw the horses in my vision: The riders wore breastplates that had the color of fire, sapphire, and sulfur. The heads of the horses were like lions’ heads, and fire, smoke, and sulfur came out of their mouths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By these three plagues—the fire, the smoke, and the sulfur that came out of their mouths—one-third of humanity was killed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the power of these horses is in their mouths and their tails. Their tails have heads like snakes, which they use to inflict pain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rest of the people who survived these plagues did not repent from their evil actions or stop worshiping demons and idols made of gold, silver, bronze, stone, and wood, which cannot see, hear, or walk.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They did not repent from their murders, their witchcraft, their sexual immorality, or their thefts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I saw another powerful angel come down from heaven. He was dressed in a cloud, and there was a rainbow over his head. His face was like the sun, and his legs were like columns of fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He held a small, opened scroll in his hand. Setting his right foot on the sea and his left foot on the land,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he shouted in a loud voice as a lion roars. When he shouted, the seven thunders spoke with voices of their own.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the seven thunders spoke, I was going to write, but I heard a voice from heaven say, “Seal up what the seven thunders have said, and don’t write it down.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the angel whom I saw standing on the sea and on the land raised his right hand to heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He swore an oath by the one who lives forever and ever, who created heaven and everything in it, the earth and everything in it, and the sea and everything in it: “There will be no more delay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the time approaches for the seventh angel to blow his trumpet, God’s secret plan will be fulfilled, as he had announced to his servants, the prophets.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the voice that I had heard from heaven spoke to me again, saying, “Go and take the opened scroll from the hand of the angel who is standing on the sea and on the land.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I went to the angel and asked him to give me the small scroll. “Take it and eat it,” he told me. “It will turn bitter in your stomach, but it will be as sweet as honey in your mouth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I took the small scroll from the angel’s hand and ate it. It was as sweet as honey in my mouth, but when I had eaten it, it turned bitter in my stomach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the seven thunders told me, “You must prophesy again about many people, nations, languages, and kings.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I was given a stick like a measuring rod. I was told, “Stand up and measure the Temple of God and the altar, and count those who worship there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But don’t measure the courtyard outside the Temple. Leave that out, because it is given to the nations, and they will trample the Holy City for 42 months.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will give my two witnesses who wear sackcloth the authority to prophesy for 1,260 days.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These witnesses are the two olive trees and the two lamp stands standing in the presence of the Lord of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if anyone should want to hurt them, fire comes out of their mouths and burns up their enemies. If anyone wants to hurt them, he must be killed in this manner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These witnesses have authority to close the heavens in order to keep rain from falling while they are prophesying. They also have authority to turn bodies of water into blood and to strike the earth with any plague, as often as they desire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they have finished their testimony, the beast that comes up from the bottomless pit will wage war against them, conquer them, and kill them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Their dead bodies will lie in the street of the great city that is spiritually called Sodom and Egypt, where their Lord was crucified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For three and a half days some members of the people, tribes, languages, and nations will look at their dead bodies and will not allow them to be placed in a tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those living on earth will gloat over them, celebrate, and send gifts to each other, because these two prophets had tormented those living on earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But after the three and a half days, the breath of life from God entered them, and they stood on their feet. Those who watched them were terrified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the witnesses heard a loud voice from heaven calling to them, “Come up here!” So they went up to heaven in a cloud, and their enemies watched them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that moment a powerful earthquake struck. One-tenth of the city collapsed, 7,000 people were killed by the earthquake, and the rest were terrified and gave glory to the God of heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The second catastrophe is over. The third catastrophe is coming very soon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the seventh angel blew his trumpet, there were loud voices in heaven, saying,
“The world’s kingdom has become
    the kingdom of our Lord and of his Messiah,
        and he will rule forever and ever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the twenty-four elders who were sitting on their thrones in God’s presence fell on their faces and worshipped God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They said,
“We give thanks to you, Lord God Almighty,
    who is and who was,
because you have taken your great power
    and have begun to rule.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The nations were angry,
    but the time for your wrath has come.
It is time for the dead to be judged—
    to reward your servants, the prophets, the saints, and all who fear your name,
        both unimportant and important,
    and to destroy those who destroy the earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Temple of God in heaven was opened, and the ark of his covenant was seen inside his Temple. There were flashes of lightning, noises, peals of thunder, an earthquake, and heavy hail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A spectacular sign appeared in the sky: a woman dressed with the sun, who had the moon under her feet and a victor’s crown of twelve stars on her head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She was pregnant and was crying out from her labor pains, the agony of giving birth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then another sign appeared in the sky: a huge red dragon with seven heads, ten horns, and seven royal crowns on its heads.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Its tail swept away one-third of the stars in the sky and knocked them down to the earth. Then the dragon stood in front of the woman who was about to give birth so that it could devour her child when it was born.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She gave birth to a son, a boy, who is to rule all the nations with an iron scepter. But her child was snatched away and taken to God and to his throne.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the woman fled into the wilderness, where a place had been prepared for her by God so that she might be taken care of for 1,260 days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then a war broke out in heaven. Michael and his angels fought with the dragon, and the dragon and its angels fought back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But it was not strong enough, and there was no longer any place for them in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The huge dragon was hurled down. That ancient serpent, called the Devil and Satan, the deceiver of the whole world, was hurled down to the earth, along with its angels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then I heard a loud voice in heaven say,
“Now the salvation, the power,
    the kingdom of our God,
        and the authority of his Messiah have come.
For the one who accuses our brothers,
    who accuses them day and night
in the presence of our God,
    has been thrown out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our brothers conquered him by the blood of the lamb
    and by the word of their testimony,
for they did not cling to their lives
    even in the face of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So be glad, heavens, and those who live in them!
How terrible it is for the earth and the sea,
    because the Devil has come down to you, filled with rage,
        knowing that his time is short!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the dragon saw that it had been thrown down to the earth, it pursued the woman who had given birth to the boy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, the woman was given the two wings of a large eagle so that she could fly away from the serpent to her place in the wilderness, where she could be taken care of for a time, times, and half a time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From its mouth the serpent spewed water like a river behind the woman in order to sweep her away with the flood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the earth helped the woman by opening its mouth and swallowing the river that the dragon had spewed from its mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The dragon became angry with the woman and went away to do battle against the rest of her children, the ones who keep God’s commandments and hold on to the testimony about Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the dragon stood on the sand of the seashore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I saw a beast coming out of the sea. It had ten horns, seven heads, and ten royal crowns on its horns. On its heads were blasphemous names.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The beast that I saw was like a leopard. Its feet were like bear’s feet, and its mouth was like a lion’s mouth. The dragon gave it his power, his throne, and complete authority.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of the beast’s heads looked like it had sustained a mortal wound, but its fatal wound was healed. Rapt with amazement, the whole world followed the beast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They worshipped the dragon because it had given authority to the beast. They also worshipped the beast, saying, “Who is like the beast, and who can fight a war with it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The beast was allowed to speak arrogant and blasphemous things, and it was given authority for 42 months.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It uttered blasphemies against God, against his name, and against his residence, that is, against those who are living in heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was allowed to wage war against the saints and to conquer them. It was also given authority over every tribe, people, language, and nation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All those who had become settled down and at home, living on the earth, will worship it, everyone whose name had not been written in the Book of Life belonging to the lamb that had been slaughtered since the foundation of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let everyone listen:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If anyone is to be taken captive,
        into captivity he will go.
If anyone is to be killed with a sword,
    with a sword he will be killed.
Here is a call for endurance and faith of the saints:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I saw another beast coming up out of the earth. It had two horns like a lamb and it talked like a dragon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It uses all the authority of the first beast on its behalf, and it makes the earth and those living on it worship the first beast, whose mortal wound was healed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It performs spectacular signs, even making fire come down from heaven to earth in front of people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It deceives those living on earth with the signs that it is allowed to do on behalf of the first beast, telling them to make an image for the beast who was wounded by a sword and yet lived.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The second beast was allowed to impart life to the image of the first beast so that the image of the beast could talk and order the execution of those who would not worship the image of the beast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The second beast forces all people—important and unimportant, rich and poor, free and slaves—to be marked on their right hands or on their foreheads,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that no one may buy or sell unless he has the mark, which is the beast’s name or the number of its name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In this case wisdom is needed: Let the person who has understanding calculate the total of the beast, since it is a human multitude, and the sum of the multitude is 600, 60, and six.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I looked, and there was the lamb, standing on Mount Zion! With him were 144,000 people who had his name and his Father’s name written on their foreheads.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I heard a sound from heaven like that of many waters and like the sound of loud thunder. The sound I heard was like harpists playing on their harps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were singing a new song in front of the throne, the four living creatures, and the elders. No one could learn the song except the 144,000 who had been redeemed from the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have not defiled themselves with women, for they are virgins, and they follow the lamb wherever he goes. They have been redeemed from among humanity as the first fruits for God and the lamb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In their mouth no lie was found. They are blameless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I saw another angel flying overhead with the eternal gospel to proclaim to those who live on earth—to every nation, tribe, language, and people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He said in a loud voice,
“Fear God and give him glory,
    because the time for him to judge has arrived.
Worship the one who made heaven and earth,
    the sea and springs of water.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then another angel, a second one, followed him, saying,
“Fallen! Babylon the Great has fallen!
    She has made all nations drink the wine,
        the wrath earned for her sexual sins.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then another angel, a third one, followed them, saying in a loud voice, “Whoever worships the beast and its image and receives a mark on his forehead or his hand
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: will drink the wine of God’s wrath, which has been poured undiluted into the cup of his anger. He will be tortured with fire and sulfur in the presence of the holy angels and the lamb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The smoke from their torture goes up forever and ever. There is no rest day or night for those who worship the beast and its image or for anyone who receives the mark of its name.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Here is a call for the endurance of the saints, who keep the commandments of God and hold fast to their faithfulness in Jesus:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I heard a voice from heaven say, “Write this:
How blessed are the dead,
    that is, those who die in the Lord from now on!”
“Yes,” says the Spirit.
    “Let them rest from their labors,
        for their actions follow them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I looked, and there was a white cloud! On the cloud sat someone who was like the Son of Man, with a gold victor’s crown on his head and a sharp sickle in his hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Another angel came out of the Temple, crying out in a loud voice to the one who sat on the cloud,
“Swing your sickle,
    and gather the harvest,
for the hour has come to gather it,
    because the harvest of the earth is fully ripe.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who sat on the cloud swung his sickle across the earth, and the earth was harvested.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then another angel came out of the Temple in heaven. He, too, had a sharp sickle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From the altar came another angel who had authority over fire. He called out in a loud voice to the angel who had the sharp sickle,
“Swing your sharp sickle,
    and gather the bunches of grapes
from the vine of the earth,
    because those grapes are ripe.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the angel swung his sickle in the earth, gathered the grapes from the earth, and threw them into the great winepress of God’s wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The wine press was trampled outside the city, and blood flowed from the wine press as high as a horse’s bridle for about 1,600 stadia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I saw another sign in heaven. It was both spectacular and amazing. There were seven angels with the seven last plagues, with which God’s wrath is completed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I saw what looked like a sea of glass mixed with fire. Those who had conquered the beast, its image, and the number of its name were standing on the sea of glass holding God’s harps in their hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They sang the song of God’s servant Moses and the song of the lamb:
“Your deeds are both spectacular and amazing,
    Lord God Almighty.
Your ways are just and true,
    King of the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lord, who won’t fear and praise your name?
    For you alone are holy,
        and all the nations will come and worship you
    because your judgments have been revealed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After these things, I looked, and the Temple, which is the Tent of Testimony in heaven, was open!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seven angels with the seven plagues came out of the Temple wearing clean, shining linen with gold sashes around their chests.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of the four living creatures gave to the seven angels seven gold bowls full of the wrath of God, who lives forever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Temple was filled with smoke from the glory of God and his power, and no one could enter the Temple until the seven plagues of the seven angels came to an end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I heard a loud voice from the Temple saying to the seven angels, “Go and pour the seven bowls of God’s wrath on the earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the first angel went and poured his bowl on the earth. A horrible, painful sore appeared on the people who had the mark of the beast and worshipped the image.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The second angel poured his bowl into the sea. It became like the blood of a dead body, and every living thing in the sea died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The third angel poured his bowl into the rivers and the springs of water, and they turned into blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then I heard the angel in charge of the water say,
“You are just. You are the one who is
    and who was, the Holy One,
        because you have judged these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have given them blood to drink
    because they spilled the blood of saints and prophets.
        This is what they deserve.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then I heard the altar reply,
“Yes, Lord God Almighty,
    your judgments are true and just.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fourth angel poured his bowl on the sun, which then was allowed to burn people with fire,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they were burned by the fierce heat. They cursed the name of God, who has the authority over these plagues. They did not repent and give him glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The fifth angel poured his bowl on the throne of the beast. Its kingdom was plunged into darkness. People gnawed on their tongues in anguish
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and cursed the God of heaven because of their pain-filled sores. But they did not repent of their behavior.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sixth angel poured his bowl on the great Euphrates River. Its water was dried up to prepare the way for the kings from the east.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I saw three disgusting spirits like frogs come out of the mouth of the dragon, out of the mouth of the beast, and out of the mouth of the false prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are demonic spirits that perform signs. They go to the kings of the whole earth and gather them for the war of the great Day of God Almighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“See, I am coming like a thief. 
How blessed is the person who remains alert
    and keeps his clothes on!
He won’t have to go naked
    and let others see his shame.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The spirits gathered the kings to the place that is called Armageddon in Hebrew.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The seventh angel threw the contents of his bowl across the sky. A loud voice came from the throne in the Temple and said, “It has happened!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were flashes of lightning, noises, peals of thunder, and a powerful earthquake. There has never been such a powerful earthquake since people have been on the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The great city was split into three parts, and the cities of the nations fell. God remembered to give Babylon the Great the cup of wine filled with the fury of his wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Every island vanished, and the mountains could no longer be found.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Huge hailstones, each weighing about a talent, fell from the sky on people, who cursed God because the plague of hail was so terrible.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then one of the seven angels who held the seven bowls came and told me, “Come, I will show you how the notorious prostitute who sits on many waters will be judged.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The kings of the earth committed sexual immorality with her, and those living on earth became drunk with the wine of her immorality.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the angel carried me away in the Spirit into a wilderness. I saw a woman sitting on a scarlet beast that was controlled by blasphemy. It had seven heads and ten horns.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman wore purple and scarlet clothes and was adorned with gold, gems, and pearls. In her hand she was holding a gold cup filled with detestable things and the impurities of her immorality.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
On her forehead was written a secret name:
Babylon the Great,
the Mother of Prostitutes
and Detestable Things of the Earth
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I saw that the woman was drunk with the blood of the saints and the blood of the witnesses to Jesus. I was very surprised when I saw her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why are you surprised?” The angel asked me. “I will tell you the secret of the woman and the beast with the seven heads and the ten horns that carries her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The beast that you saw existed once, but is no longer, and is going to crawl out of the bottomless pit and then proceed to its destruction. Those living on earth, whose names were not written in the Book of Life from the foundation of the world, will be surprised when they see the beast because it was, is no longer, and will come again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This calls for a mind that has wisdom. The seven heads are seven mountains on which the woman is sitting. They are also seven kings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Five of them have fallen, one is living, and the other has not yet come. When he comes, he must remain in power for a little while.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The beast that was and is no longer is the eighth king, but it belongs with the seven kings and goes to its destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The ten horns that you saw are ten kings who have not yet received a kingdom. They will receive authority to rule as kings with the beast for one hour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have one purpose: to give their power and authority to the beast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will wage war against the lamb, but the lamb will conquer them because he is Lord of lords and King of kings. Those who are called, chosen, and faithful are with him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel also told me, “The bodies of water you saw, on which the prostitute is sitting, are people, multitudes, nations, and languages.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The ten horns and the beast you saw will hate the prostitute. They will leave her abandoned and naked. They will eat her flesh and burn her up with fire,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for God has placed within them a desire to carry out his purpose by uniting to give their kingdom to the beast until God’s words are fulfilled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman you saw is the great city that rules over the kings of the earth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After these things, I saw another angel coming down from heaven. He had great authority, and the earth was made bright by his splendor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He cried out in a powerful voice,
“Fallen! Babylon the Great has fallen!
    She has become a home for demons.
She is a prison for every unclean spirit,
    a prison for every unclean bird,
    and a prison for every unclean
        and hated beast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For all the nations have drunk
    from the wine of her sexual immorality,
and the kings of the earth have committed sexual immorality with her.
The world’s businesses have become rich
    from her luxurious excesses.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then I heard another voice from heaven saying,
“Come out of her, my people,
    so that you don’t participate in her sins
        and also suffer from her diseases.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For her sins are piled as high as heaven,
    and God has remembered her crimes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do to her as she herself has done,
    and give her double for her deeds.
Mix a double drink for her in the cup she mixed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Just as she glorified herself and lived in luxury,
    inflict on her just as much torture and misery. 
In her heart she says,
    ‘I am a queen on a throne, not a widow.
        I will never see misery.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For this reason, her diseases that result in death, misery, and famine
    will come in a single day.
She will be burned up in a fire,
    because powerful is the Lord God who judges her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The kings of the earth, who committed sexual immorality with her and lived in luxury with her, will cry and mourn over her when they see the smoke rising from the fire that consumes her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Frightened by the torture that she experiences, they will stand far away and cry out,
“How terrible, how terrible it is for that great city,
    the powerful city Babylon,
        because your judgment arrived in a single hour!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The world’s businesses cry and mourn over her, because no one buys their cargo anymore—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: cargo of gold, silver, gems, pearls, fine linen, purple cloth, silk, scarlet cloth, all kinds of scented wood, all articles made of ivory, all articles made of very costly wood, bronze, iron, marble,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: cinnamon, spice, incense, myrrh, frankincense, wine, olive oil, flour, wheat, cattle, sheep, horses, chariots, and slaves (that is, human souls)—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The fruit that you crafted has abandoned you.
    All your dainties and your splendor are lost,
        and no one will ever find them again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Frightened by the severity of her punishment, businesses that had become rich because of her will stand at a distance, crying and mourning:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“How terrible, how terrible it is for the great city
    that was clothed in fine linen, purple, and scarlet
        and was adorned with gold, gems, and pearls,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because all this wealth has been destroyed in a single hour!”
Every ship’s captain, everyone who traveled by ship, sailors, and everyone who made a living from the sea stood far away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they saw the smoke rising from the fire that consumed her, they began to cry out, “What city was like that great city?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they threw dust on their heads and shouted while crying and mourning:
“How terrible, how terrible it is for the great city,
    where all who had ships at sea became rich from her wealth,
        because it has been destroyed in a single hour!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be happy about her, heaven, saints, apostles, and prophets,
    for God has condemned her for you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then a powerful angel picked up a stone that was like a large millstone and threw it into the sea, saying,
“The great city Babylon will be thrown down violently—
    and will never be found again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sound of harpists, musicians, flutists, and trumpeters
    will never be heard within you again.
No artisan of any trade
    will ever be found within you again.
The sound of a millstone
    will never be heard within you again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The light from a lamp
    will never shine within you again.
The voice of a bridegroom and bride
    will never be heard within you again.
For your merchants were the important people of the world,
    and all the nations were deceived by your witchcraft.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The blood of the world’s prophets, saints,
    and all who had been murdered
        was found within her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
After these things, I heard what sounded like the loud voice of a large crowd in heaven, saying,
“Hallelujah!
    Salvation, glory, and power belong to our God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His judgments are true and just.
    He has condemned the notorious prostitute
        who corrupted the world with her immorality.
He has taken revenge on her
    for the blood of his servants.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A second time they said,
“Hallelujah!
    The smoke goes up from her forever and ever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The twenty-four elders and the four living creatures bowed down and worshipped God, who was sitting on the throne. They said, “Amen! Hallelujah!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A voice came from the throne, saying,
“Praise our God,
    all who serve and fear him,
from the least important
    to the most important.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then I heard what sounded like the voice of a large crowd, like the sound of raging waters, and like the sound of powerful thunderclaps, saying,
“Hallelujah!
    The Lord our God, the Almighty, is reigning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let us rejoice, be glad, and give him glory,
    because the marriage of the lamb has come
        and his bride has made herself ready.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She has been given the privilege of wearing fine linen,
    dazzling and pure.”
(The fine linen represents the righteous deeds of the saints.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the angel told me, “Write this: ‘How blessed are those who are invited to the marriage supper of the lamb!’” He also told me, “These are the true words of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I bowed down at his feet to worship him, but he told me, “Don’t do that! I am a fellow servant with you and with your brothers who rely on what Jesus is saying. Worship God, because what Jesus is saying is the spirit of prophecy!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I saw heaven standing open, and there was a white horse! Its rider is named Faithful and True. He administers justice and wages war righteously.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His eyes are like a flame of fire, and on his head are many royal crowns. He has a name written on him that nobody knows except himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is dressed in a robe dipped in blood, and his name is called the Word of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The armies of heaven, wearing fine linen, white and pure, follow him on white horses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A sharp sword comes out of his mouth to strike down the nations. He will rule them with an iron rod and tread the winepress of the fury of the wrath of God Almighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
On his robe that covers his thigh he has a name written:
King of Kings and Lord of Lords
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I saw an angel standing in the sun. He cried out in a loud voice to all the birds flying overhead, “Come! Gather for the great supper of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eat the flesh of kings, the flesh of commanders, the flesh of warriors, the flesh of horses and their riders, and the flesh of all people, both free and slaves, both unimportant and important.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I saw the beast, the kings of the earth, and their armies gathered to wage war against the rider on the horse and his army.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The beast was captured, along with the false prophet who had performed signs on its behalf. By these signs the false prophet had deceived those who had received the mark of the beast and worshipped its image. Both of them were thrown alive into the lake of fire that burns with sulfur.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rest were killed by the sword that belonged to the rider on the horse and that came from his mouth, and all the birds gorged themselves with their flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I saw an angel coming down from heaven, holding the key to the bottomless pit, with a large chain in his hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He captured the dragon, that ancient serpent, also known as the Devil and Satan, and tied him up for a thousand years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He threw him into the bottomless pit, locked it, and sealed it over him to keep him from deceiving the nations anymore until the thousand years were over. After that, he must be set free for a little while.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I saw thrones, and those who sat on them were given authority to judge. I also saw the souls of those who had been beheaded because of their testimony about Jesus and because of the word of God. They had not worshipped the beast or its image and had not received its mark on their foreheads or hands. They came back to life and ruled with the Messiah for a thousand years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The rest of the dead did not come back to life until the thousand years were over. This is the first resurrection.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How blessed and holy are those who participate in the first resurrection! The second death has no power over them. They will be priests of God and the Messiah, and will rule with him for a thousand years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the thousand years are over, Satan will be freed from his prison.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will go out to deceive Gog and Magog, the nations at the four corners of the earth, and gather them for war. They are as numerous as the sands of the seashore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They marched over the broad expanse of the earth and surrounded the camp of the saints and the beloved city. Fire came from God out of heaven and burned them up,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Devil who deceived them was thrown into the lake of fire and sulfur, where the beast and the false prophet were. They will be tortured day and night forever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I saw a large, white throne and the one who was sitting on it. The earth and the heavens fled from his presence, and no place was found for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I saw the dead, both unimportant and important, standing in front of the throne, and books were open. Another book was opened—the Book of Life. The dead were judged according to their actions, as recorded in the books.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sea gave up the dead that were in it, and Death and Hades gave up the dead that were in them, and all were judged according to their actions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Death and Hades were thrown into the lake of fire. (This is the second death—the lake of fire.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone whose name was not found written in the Book of Life was thrown into the lake of fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I saw a new heaven and a new earth, because the first heaven and the first earth had disappeared, and the sea was gone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I also saw the holy city, New Jerusalem, coming down from God out of heaven, prepared like a bride adorned for her husband.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I heard a loud voice from the throne say,
“See, the tent of God is among humans!
    He will make his home with them,
        and they will be his people.
God himself will be with them,
    and he will be their God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will wipe every tear from their eyes.
    There won’t be death anymore.
There won’t be any grief, crying, or pain,
    because the first things have disappeared.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The one sitting on the throne said, “See, I am making all things new!”
He said, “Write this: ‘These words are trustworthy and true.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he told me, “It has happened! I am the Alpha and the Omega, the beginning and the end. I will freely give a drink from the spring of the water of life to the one who is thirsty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The person who overcomes will inherit these things. I will be his God, and he will be my son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But people who are cowardly, unfaithful, detestable, murderers, sexually immoral, sorcerers, idolaters, and all liars will find themselves in the lake that burns with fire and sulfur. This is the second death.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then one of the seven angels who had the seven bowls full of the seven last plagues came to me and said, “Come! I will show you the bride, the wife of the lamb.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He carried me away in the Spirit to a large, high mountain and showed me the holy city, Jerusalem, coming down from God out of heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The glory of God was its radiance, and its light was like a valuable gem, like jasper, as clear as crystal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It had a large, high wall with twelve gates. Twelve angels were at the gates, and the names of the twelve tribes of Israel were written on the gates.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There were three gates on the east, three gates on the north, three gates on the south, and three gates on the west.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The wall of the city had twelve foundations, and the twelve names of the twelve apostles of the lamb were written on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The angel who was talking to me had a gold measuring rod to measure the city, its gates, and its walls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The city was cubic in shape: its length was the same as its width. He measured the city with his rod, and it measured at 12,000 stadia:Its length, width, and height were the same.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He also measured its wall. According to the human measurement that the angel was using, it was 144 cubits.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Its wall was made of jasper. The city was made of pure gold, as clear as glass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The foundations of the city wall were decorated with all kinds of gems: The first foundation was jasper, the second sapphire, the third agate, the fourth emerald,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the fifth onyx, the sixth carnelian, the seventh chrysolite, the eighth beryl, the ninth topaz, the tenth chrysoprase, the eleventh jacinth and the twelfth amethyst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The twelve gates were twelve pearls, and each gate was made of a single pearl. The street of the city was made of pure gold, as clear as glass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I saw no temple in it, because the Lord God Almighty and the lamb are its temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The city doesn’t need any sun or moon to give it light, because the glory of God gave it light, and the lamb was its lamp.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The nations will walk in its light, and the kings of the earth will bring their glory into it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Its gates will never be shut at the end of the day—because there will be no night there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: People will bring the glory and wealth of the nations into it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nothing unclean, or anyone who does anything detestable, and no one who tells lies will ever enter it. Only those whose names are written in the lamb’s Book of Life will enter it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the angel showed me the river of the water of life, as clear as crystal. It was flowing from the throne of God and the lamb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Between the city street and the river, the tree of life was visible from each side. It produced twelve kinds of fruit, each month having its own fruit. The leaves of the tree are for the healing of the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There will no longer be any curse. The throne of God and the lamb will be in the city. His servants will worship him
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and see his face, and his name will be on their foreheads.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There will be no more night, and they will not need any light from lamps or the sun because the Lord God will shine on them. They will rule forever and ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told me, “These words are trustworthy and true. The Lord God of the spirits and of the prophets has sent his messenger to show his servants the things that must happen soon.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “See! I am coming soon! How blessed is the person who keeps the words of the prophecy in this book!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I, John, heard and saw these things. When I had heard and seen them, I bowed down to worship at the feet of the angel who had been showing me these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he told me, “Don’t do that! I am a fellow servant with you, your brothers the prophets, and those who keep the words in this book. Worship God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he told me, “Don’t seal up the words of the prophecy in this book, because the time is near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let the one who does what is evil continue to do what is evil. Let the filthy person continue to be filthy. Let the righteous person continue to do what is right. And let the holy person continue to be holy.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “See! I am coming soon! My reward is with me to repay everyone according to his behavior.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am the Alpha and the Omega, the first and the last, the beginning and the end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “How blessed are those who wash their robes so that they may have the right to the tree of life and may go through the gates into the city!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Outside are dogs, sorcerers, immoral people, murderers, idolaters, and everyone who loves and practices falsehood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I, Jesus, have sent my angel to give this testimony to you for the churches. I am the root and descendant of David, the bright morning star.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Spirit and the bride say, “Come!”
Let everyone who hears this say, “Come!”
Let everyone who is thirsty come!
Let anyone who wants the water of life take it as a gift!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I warn everyone who hears the words of the prophecy in this book: If anyone adds anything to them, God will strike him with the plagues that are written in this book.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone takes away any words from the book of this prophecy, God will take away his portion of the tree of life and the holy city that are described in this book.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The one who is testifying to these things says, “Yes, I am coming soon!”
Amen! Come, Lord Jesus!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
May the grace of the Lord Jesus be with all the saints.
Amen.
verses.speaker: Narrator
